title.rendered: Mamun led the police for the second time in a row

content.rendered:
Md. Abul Kashem Mamun is an integral name of Police Archery Club. He continues to play a great role as a coach and team leader.This archer of Narail is becoming the charioteer of one success after another of the Police Archery Club. Police won three medals in Open National Ranking Tournament-1 today.

In the Open National Ranking Tournament-1, Ashikuzzaman Anai of Bangladesh Police Archery Club, Compound Division won the gold medal by defeating Bangladesh Army. Shyamli Roy bagged a silver medal and Tamimul Islam a bronze medal in the recurve division.

Earlier, Bangladesh Police Archery Club became the champion in the recurve division in the league final round of the country for the second time in a row. They scored a total of 60 points and surpassed others.

Bangladesh Sports Education Institute came second with 54 points. Bangladesh Ansar is third with 52 points.  

A total of 8 clubs including Bangladesh Army, Bangladesh Air Force, Bangladesh Ansar, Border Guard Bangladesh, Bangladesh Sports Education Institute participated in this league.

Mohammad Tamimul Islam, Hakim Ahmed Rubel, Azimul Haque, Yasin Arafat, Rahim Hossain Chowdhury, Beauty Roy, Iti Khatun and Jyoti Rani participated in the recurve division on behalf of Bangladesh Police Club in this competition.

And participated in the compound division. Abul Kashem Mamun, Mohammad Ashikuzzaman, Bhanrum Bom and Shyamoli Roy.

Bangladesh Time: 2129 Hours, February 15, 2024
